intro: Sida carpinifolia f. antilliana, commonly known as the Antillean sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial species characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish to greenish flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The species is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, showcasing its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
